Summary I am currently in a PhD program at DePaul University in Computer and Information Sciences researching flow in games. I study what makes games fun and how to make games and non-game designs more fun with user research. 
 
I make website, application, and game designs more engaging, usable, and enjoyable by applying psychology and human-computer interaction research. I have done this at two game development companies, Ubisoft Montreal and 1st Playable Productions. While at Ubisoft, I created and put into practice research methods to make their games more fun. 
 
I have been teaching courses and consulting for the largest user experience firm in the world, Human Factors International. I took HFI's training courses and passed their exam to become a Certified Usability Analyst ten years ago, and I recently became a Certified User Experience Analyst. I was also trained at HFI to do Persuasion, Emotion, and Trust (PET) interviews, a method focused on understanding the emotional drives, blocks, feelings, and beliefs around a desired user action. 
 
My Masters was in Positive Organizational Psychology and Evaluation at Claremont Graduate University. My research advisor was Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, co-founder of the field of positive psychology and author of Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience.  
 
I have lived in China, Montreal, India, and Japan. I grew up in Fairfield, Iowa, and I'm currently living in Chicago, Illinois. 
 
Specialties:  
• Usability testing and in-depth interviews 
• Measuring flow, flow conditions, and user motivation 
• Heuristic evaluation, task analysis, cognitive walkthrough, and user-interface design 
• SPSS, Balsamiq, Morae, Visio, PowerPoint, Excel, Word Summary I am currently in a PhD program at DePaul University in Computer and Information Sciences researching flow in games. I study what makes games fun and how to make games and non-game designs more fun with user research.

Summary I am an experienced usability analyst, information architect, and interaction designer who specializes in designing user interfaces for software and websites. That means I help companies make products and sites that naturally guide their audiences to find information and complete tasks. 
 
My projects range from designing large and mission-critical business software to concise and mobile apps. I work with project managers and development teams to ensure project goals and user needs are met. I have experience gathering user requirements, interviewing users and stakeholders, developing personas, wireframing and specifying designs, and conducting usability tests. 
 
I have a graduate degree in Business Administration as well as a science degree in human ecology—an interdisciplinary field that combines sociology, science, and business. I focused on communication technology. 
 
Specialties: Organizing information on a website so your audience can find things easily. Migrating key features from your large software system or SaaS site into a task-focused mobile app. Usability testing both prototypes and released products. Influencing the development process to help team members understand and rely on the contributions of usability analysts, information architects, and interface designers.
